New Records: Trent Boult bowled four maidens, the first player to do so at the Twenty20 World Cup, and second in T20 history.
Key Match Events: Trent Boult and Tim Southee shared the new ball for New Zealand
Lockie Ferguson replaced Boult and bowled an historic spell, finishing with 3-0
Finn Allen made a first-ball duck in the chase
Rachin Ravindra was dismissed by Kabua Morea
Devon Conway made 35 from 32 before being trapped lbw by Semo Kamea
Daryl Mitchell made quick work of it, striking 19 off 12 balls to complete the win
Pre-Game Insights: Trent Boult reflected on his time bowling alongside Tim Southee, calling it a 'partnership that Iâ€™ve really enjoyed forming'
Post-Match Reflections: Trent Boult said it was 'an unusual feeling' to be finishing up their tournament and his Twenty20 international career in a group game
Boult confirmed his Twenty20 career for New Zealand was done
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Caps finished third in their group
New Zealand went into the game in a difficult position, needing an expected thrashing to avoid finishing their campaign with not-unexpected victories over minnows Uganda and Papua New Guinea
